sen.j: 三山木駅（みやまきえき）は、京都府京田辺市にある、近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Kyotanabe City of Kyoto Prefecture, Miyamaki Station is a stop on the Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Miyamaki Station, located in Kyotanabe City of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Miyamaki Station, located in Kyotanabe City of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of the Kintetsu Corporation.
sen.cmt: 既出の記事と表現を統一

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ高架駅。
sen.e: An elevated station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks.
There is an elevated station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks.
It is an elevated station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.
sen.cmt: 既出の記事と表現を統一

sen.j: ホーム有効長は6両。
sen.e: Effective length of platforms can accommodate six cars.
The platforms are of a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.
The platform length is sufficient to accommodate six cars.
sen.cmt: 既出の記事と表現を統一

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみ。
sen.e: Ticket gates are installed at only one place.
Ticket gates are found in only one location.
Ticket gates are found in only one location.

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: Automated ticket gates installed are of Toshiba manufacture.
The automated ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.
The automated ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.

sen.j: 赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: Red colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting and are PiTaPa and ICOCA Cards compatible.
The red-colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting and are compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.
The red-colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting and are compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization status
Usage status
Usage status

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は3,610人。
sen.e: A survey conducted on Nov. 8, 2005 revealed that 3,610 passengers got on or off at this station on that day.
A survey conducted on Nov. 8, 2005 found that 3,610 passengers got on or off at this station on that day.
A survey conducted on November 8, 2005 revealed that the number of passengers who got on and off at this station that day was 3,610.
sen.cmt: 既出の記事と表現を統一

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、145位。
sen.e: Ranked 145th amongst all (323) Kintetsu stations subject to the survey on that day.
sen.cmt: 括弧内一部記述は重複しておりかつ無意味ですので割愛しました。
sen.e: It ranked 145th among all 323 Kintetsu stations subject to the survey on that day.
It was ranked 145th among all Kintetsu stations (323 stations on that date) subject to the survey.
sen.cmt: 既出の記事と表現を統一

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、22位。
sen.e: Ranked 22nd amongst the (26) stations (including Yamato-Saidaiji Station) on the Kyoto Line.
It ranked twenty-second among the 26 stations (including Yamato-Saidaiji Station) on the Kyoto Line.
It ranked twenty-second among the 26 stations (including Yamato-Saidaiji Station) on the Kyoto Line.

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、20位。
sen.e: Ranked 20th amongst the (23) Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked twentieth among the 23 Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked twentieth among the 23 Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Station surroundings
Station surroundings
Station surroundings

sen.j: 駅前のバスターミナルからは、学校法人同志社京田辺キャンパス（同志社大学、同志社女子大学、同志社国際高等学校）方面へのバスの発着が多い。
sen.e: Many buses shuttle between Doshisha Kyotanabe Campus (Doshisha University, Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts, Doshisha International Senior High School) and the bus terminal in front of the station.

Many buses shuttle between Doshisha Kyotanabe Campus (Doshisha University, Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts, Doshisha International Senior High School) and the bus terminal in front of the station.

Many buses shuttle between Doshisha Kyotanabe Campus (Doshisha University, Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts, Doshisha International Senior High School) and the bus terminal in front of the station.

sen.j: 学校法人同志社京田辺キャンパスへはJR同志社前駅や近畿日本鉄道興戸駅が近いが、その両駅にはバスが乗り入れていない。
sen.e: JR Doshisha-mae Station and Kintetsu Kodo Station are located nearer Doshisha Kyotanabe Campus, but there are no bus routes operating out of or to either of the two stations.
JR Doshisha-mae Station and Kintetsu Kodo Station are located nearer to the Doshisha Kyotanabe Campus, but there are no bus routes operating from or to either of the two stations.
JR Doshisha-mae Station and Kintetsu Kodo Station are located nearer to the Doshisha Kyotanabe Campus, but there are no bus routes operating from or to either of the two stations.

sen.j: そのため、奈良交通は近鉄三山木駅と片町線JR三山木駅を同志社へのバスの玄関口として位置づけ、バス利用の促進のために同志社の学生・教職員を対象とした特別の割引回数券を販売している。
sen.e: From such circumstances, Nara Kotsu Bus Lines position Kintetsu Miyamaki Station and JR Miyamaki Station (Katamachi Line) as bus gateways to Doshisha and sell special discount coupon tickets to Doshisha students and faculty members to promote their riding on buses.

Given such circumstances, Nara Kotsu Bus Lines position Kintetsu Miyamaki Station and JR Miyamaki Station (Katamachi Line) as bus gateways to Doshisha and sell special discount coupon tickets to Doshisha students and faculty members in order to promote their use of the buses.

Given such circumstances, Nara Kotsu Bus Lines position Kintetsu Miyamaki Station and JR Miyamaki Station (Katamachi Line) as bus gateways to Doshisha and sell special discount coupon tickets to Doshisha students and faculty members in order to promote their use of the buses.

sen.j: JR三山木駅 - 西日本旅客鉄道片町線。
sen.e: JR Miyamaki Station - West Japan Railway Company Katamachi Line
JR Miyamaki Station - West Japan Railway Company Katamachi Line
JR Miyamaki Station - West Japan Railway Company Katamachi Line

sen.j: ほぼ隣接した形になっており、駅前広場（バスターミナル、タクシー乗降場）を共用している。
sen.e: They are almost adjacent to each other and share the station's forecourt (bus terminal and taxi stands.)
They are nearly adjacent to each other and share the station's forecourt (bus terminal and taxi stands).
They are nearly adjacent to each other and share the station's forecourt (bus terminal and taxi stands).

sen.e: Kyotanabe Municipal Miyamaki Elementary School
Kyotanabe Municipal Miyamaki Elementary School
Kyotanabe Municipal Miyamaki Elementary School

Miyamaki Post Office
Miyamaki Post Office

sen.j: 京都厚生年金休暇センター（ウェルサンピア京都）...バス (交通機関)の場合は新田辺駅からも便利。
sen.e: Wel Sunpia Kyoto…If going there by bus (public transportation,) getting off at Shin-Tanabe Station is also convenient.
Wel Sunpia Kyoto…If going there by bus (public transportation), it is also convenient to get off at Shin-Tanabe Station.
Wel Sunpia Kyoto…If going there by bus (public transportation), it is also convenient to get off at Shin-Tanabe Station.

sen.e: Bus stop: Miyamaki-eki-mae/Futamata (along National Highway Route No.24)
Bus stop: Miyamaki-eki-mae/Futamata (along National Highway Route No. 24)
Bus stop: Miyamaki-eki-mae/Futamata (along National Route 24)

sen.e: 72 Kyotanabe City Hall
72 Kyotanabe City Hall

sen.j: 特徴
sen.e: Characteristics
Characteristics
Characteristics

sen.j: この駅には電留線も待避線も無いにもかかわらず、近鉄電車の奈良線系統の方向幕には「急行｜三山木」や「準急｜三山木」などが装備されていた。
sen.e: Although this station does not have tracks to park trains or for them to take refuge, Kintetsu Nara Line at one time had directional screens denoted 'Express Miyamaki, ' 'Local express Miyamaki,' etc.
Although this station does not have tracks to park trains or provide refuge, at one time the Kintetsu Nara Line had directional screens denoted 'Express Miyamaki, ' 'Local express Miyamaki,' etc.
Although this station doesn't have tracks to park trains or provide refuge, at one time the Kintetsu Nara Line had directional screens that denoted 'Express Miyamaki, ' 'Semi-Express Miyamaki,' etc.

sen.j: これは、西大寺方に隣接する近鉄宮津駅が宮津車庫設置当初は信号場扱い（三山木信号所）であったことによる措置だが、ほどなくして同信号場は駅へ昇格し、2006年3月のダイヤ改正で奈良線に区間準急が登場した事による方向幕追加の必要も生じたため、この2つの幕は消滅した。
sen.e: This resulted from a measure taken for neighboring Kintetsu Miyazu Station towards Saidaiji having been treated as a signal station (Miyamaki Signal Station) at the outset when Miyazu Shako depot was established, but soon thereafter, said signal station was upgraded to a railway station and as such, created a need to install additional directional screens from the introduction of regional local express trains on the Nara Line emanating from timetable revision in March 2006, eliminating the two aforesaid screens.
sen.cmt: 区間準急→regional local express→regional semi express(近鉄では準急をsemi expressとしているので）
sen.e: This resulted from a measure taken for the neighboring Kintetsu Miyazu Station toward Saidaiji having been treated as a signal station (Miyamaki Signal Station) at the outset when Miyazu Shako depot was established, but soon thereafter said signal station was upgraded to a railway station and as such it created a need to install additional directional screens from the introduction of regional local express trains on the Nara Line emanating from the timetable revision of March 2006, thereby eliminating the two aforesaid screens.

This resulted from a measure taken for the neighboring Kintetsu-Miyazu Station located in the direction of Saidaiji having been treated as a signal station (Miyamaki Signal Station) at the outset, when Miyazu Shako depot was established, but soon thereafter said signal station was upgraded to a railway station and as such it created a need to install additional directional screens from the introduction of regional semi-express trains on the Nara Line emanating from the timetable revision of March 2006, thereby eliminating the two aforementioned screens.
sen.cmt: 区間準急→regional semi express Kintetsu-Miyazu

sen.j: また、それ以外にも「急行｜（大和）西大寺 この車両三山木まで」や「準急｜奈良 この車両三山木まで」などの増解結の方向幕も装備されている。
sen.e: Other than the above-mentioned, directional screens such as 'Express (Yamato) Saidaiji,' 'This car only up to Miyamaki' and 'Local express Nara, this car only up to Miyamaki,' etc., indicative of adding or disconnecting cars are also installed.

Other than as mentioned above, directional screens such as 'Express (Yamato) Saidaiji,' 'This car only up to Miyamaki' and 'Local express Nara, this car only up to Miyamaki,' etc., as indicative of adding or disconnecting cars, are also installed.

Other than as mentioned above, directional screens such as 'Express (Yamato) Saidaiji,' 'This car only up to Miyamaki' and 'Semi Express Nara, this car only up to Miyamaki,' etc., as indicative of adding or disconnecting cars, are also installed.

sen.j: しかし当然、そのような運用は現在は1本も無い。
sen.e: As a matter of course, however, there is not a single train so operated as of now.
Of course, today there isn't a single train operating in that manner.
Of course, today there is not a single train operating in that manner.

sen.j: ただし過去に新田辺発三山木行きの臨時普通が走っていた。
sen.e: However, there was a time in the past when occasional Miyamaki bound local trains leaving Shin-Tanabe were in operation.
However, there was a time in the past when occasional Miyamaki bound local trains leaving Shin-Tanabe were in operation.
However, there was a time in the past when occasional Miyamaki bound local trains leaving Shin-Tanabe were in operation.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月3日 奈良電気鉄道桃山御陵前駅～西大寺（現・大和西大寺駅）間開通時に開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated on Nov. 3, 1928 when the section between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji (now Yamato-Saidaiji) Station on Nara Electric Railways commenced operations.
Inaugurated on Nov. 3, 1928 when the section between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji (now Yamato-Saidaiji) Station on Nara Electric Railways commenced operations.
November 3, 1928: The station was inaugurated when the section between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji (now Yamato-Saidaiji) Station on Nara Electric Railway opened for operation.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Kintetsu Corporation station on Oct. 1, 1963 as a result of amalgamation.
Became a Kintetsu Corporation station on Oct. 1, 1963 as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1963: The station became a Kintetsu Corporation station as a result of the amalgamation.

sen.j: 2004年（平成16年）7月10日 京都方面ホームが高架化開業。
sen.e: Operations using elevated platform for trains bound for Kyoto commenced on July 10, 2004.
Operations using elevated platform for trains bound for Kyoto commenced on July 10, 2004.
July 10, 2004: Operations using elevated platform for trains bound for Kyoto commenced.

sen.j: 2005年（平成17年）8月6日 大和西大寺方面ホームが高架化開業し、高架化完成。
sen.e: Operations using elevated platform for trains bound for Yamato-Saidaiji commenced on Aug. 6, 2005 thus completing elevated construction works.
Operations using elevated platform for trains bound for Yamato-Saidaiji commenced on Aug. 6, 2005 thus completing elevated construction works.
August 6, 2005: Operations using elevated platform for trains bound for Yamato-Saidaiji commenced, thus completing the elevated construction work.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: Use of PiTaPa Cards commenced on April 1, 2007.
Use of PiTaPa Cards commenced on April 1, 2007.
April 1, 2007: The use of PiTaPa cards commenced.
